page.title: 04Farming around N.Edenbridge
page.content: Our area has mainly arable and cattle farming. A local cattle farm has 75 cattle and 63 sheep. It has 100 acres some of which is rented out. The farm has a baler,mower,kedder,turner,a bale loader,harrow,rollers and a muck spreader. Today there are many health regulations that the farmer has carry out by law. The animals have to have tubercloses (once every other year) and brucellosis (every year) injections. Diseases on the farm include new forest disease(eye infection),ringworm,fly born disease, and others. Sheep are commonly effected by fowel foot and foot rot. Warble fly is also common. It is a plague and has a strange life cycle. Its maggot eats its way through the sheeps insides. Lamb are treated in the Autumn for most diseases.
